description.narrative: Appraisal of the Global Commission on Adaptation

policy-marker.narrative: Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Action Tracks: At least 8 high-impact Action Tracks on the main subthemes will have been conceived, launched and taken into implementation by the main proponents in these areas.

comment.narrative: Action Tracks have not been established, published or implemented.

title.narrative: Communication and Outreach: A concerted campaign to ensure that adaptation is globally recognized as a political priority. The reputation and political clout of Conveners and Commissioners will have been put to optimal use for this purpose.

- 15 one minute "First Person" high quality films for distribution primarily through social media, explaining the ’human’ story of the importance and urgency of adaptation - Hashtag campaign to generate social content and galvanize support - 25 Op-eds in high-profile, influential global media outlets. - Web and digital content (blogs, articles, social media videos) - High quality website featuring a ’Solutions Blog’ for Commission members and partners, and other externally-sourced content - "How to communicate about adaptation" toolkit, based upon an extensive research programme for practitioners.
Indicators: - Profile of adaptation issues among non-environmental policymakers and politicians. - Awareness of adaptation issues among the climate-concerned constituents and other stakeholders driving political action. - Incorporation of adaptation issues within climate change campaigns

comment.narrative: Climate change adaptation has a low public profile and there is limited understanding of it beyond practitioners and policymakers working directly on climate issues.

title.narrative: A flagship research report released in September 2019, that will foster a compelling, evidence-based and widely shared global understanding of the adaptation imperative. In support hereof, a substantial number of background papers on subthemes.

comment.narrative: No flagship report or background papers covering the specific topics and approach to ‘make the case’.

title.narrative: States, cities, companies, communities – supported by the GCA and its partners – intensify their efforts to become climate resilient and are better equipped to do so.

comment.narrative: The Global Commission on Adaptation consisted of 28 commissioners from 19 ‘convening countries’ at the launch. No Action Tracks and commitments defined were defined at this stage.
